R Markdown lets you write text, run R code, and include math in one reproducible document.

This document shows how Markdown text, R code, and math can work together.

Inline math: $\alpha + \beta = \gamma$

y = mx + b

```{r}
library(ggplot2)

ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = wt, y = mpg)) +
  geom_point() +
  labs(title = "MPG vs Weight")

summary(mtcars$mpg)
```
